title: Update libwebp to 1.6.0
body:
## Summary
Update libwebp version in cgmanifest.json from 1.3.2 to 1.6.0.

## Companion PR
- mono/skia#166 (contains DEPS and BUILD.gn changes)

## libwebp 1.6.0 Release Notes
- **Security fix**: heap overflow in webpmux (`-get`/`-set`)
- Speed and compression improvements
- Histogram optimizations
- New AVX2 optimizations (optional, auto-enabled when available)
- Various bug fixes

## Testing
- ✅ Local macOS arm64 build succeeded
- ✅ All SkiaSharp tests passed (5340 passed)

## Links
- [libwebp v1.6.0 tag](https://chromium.googlesource.com/webm/libwebp/+/refs/tags/v1.6.0)

comments.author: github-actions[bot]
comments.body:
**Triage Summary**  

Labels will be applied to indicate compatibility with macOS as the local arm64 build succeeded, signaling a successful run on that platform.

This issue is not classified as a regression since it pertains to updating a library version without performance or compatibility concerns with the previous version of SkiaSharp.

Additional remarks:
* The issue focuses on an update to the libwebp library and does not relate to any existing labels, including specific areas like SkiaSharp or documentation.
* There are no applicable labels regarding backend technologies or graphics APIs mentioned in the issue.

<details>
<summary>Detailed Summary and Actions</summary>

Summary of the triage:

- The issue confirms compatibility with macOS due to a successful local macOS arm64 build.
- The focus of the issue is the update of the libwebp library, which is not covered by current labels.
- There are no concerns regarding performance, reliability, or compatibility with the previous version of SkiaSharp.
- The issue does not relate to any backend technology or graphics API associated with available labels.

Summary of the actions that will be performed:

| Action     | Item        | Description                                                                          |
| :--------- | :---------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Apply Label| os/macOS    | The issue mentions the successful build on macOS arm64, indicating macOS compatibility. |

</details>



_This entire triage process was automated by AI and mistakes may have been made. Please let us know so we can continue to improve._
